intro: Townsendia fendleri, commonly known as desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky slopes and sandy soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Townsendia fendleri is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
